medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed right upper quadrant pain three days prior to admission, which persisted. The patient also experienced some nausea and vomiting during the first two days. Initially, the patient thought that gallstones would likely pass but presented to the emergency department due to the persistence of her symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gallstone pancreatitis status post ERCP and sphincterectomy; Hypertension; Hyperlipidemia; Coronary artery disease status post 4 vessel CABG; Hysterectomy for uterine bleeding; Right hemicolectomy for colon cancer.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of uterine cancer; Father had diabetes and Parkinson's disease.
